dialogues.ERIC:
[1]Hey you madman! 
[2]What happened to you?  I thought you were going to call. 
[3]Oh I see.  You have been busy. 
[4]That's good, but now I am here.  So let's go.  We have a lot to talk about. 
[5]Is she your girlfriend? 
[6]Fuck her. 
[7]She's a dishrag whore.  Kick her out. 
[8]Don't be silly.  It's dangerous. 
[9][Okay.  Get out of the shower.  It's time for you to leave.] 
[10][No.  Come on you fucking slut!] 
[11]Don't worry about her. [Why don't you just go back to your pimp and suck his black dick!] 
[12]God damn it! 
[13][Get the fuck out of here you fucking whore!] 
[14]God damn it.  Look at my hand. 
[15]Oh shit.  Her clothes. 
[16]La ferme! 
[17]So tell me, what have you been up to? 
[18]Oh.  Well, then why didn't you stop me. 
[19]Look, your whole life you've done nothing but fuck whores.  A girl like that will give you AIDS.  Why don't you find a nice girl in the suburbs? 
[20]Just use your hand like me. 
[21]I don't understand.  Anyway, it's too late.  Get dressed, let's go out and meet the boys. 
[22]No, in Paris it's good to smell like you've been fucking.  It will make them respect you. 
[23]Just put on a shirt and a sport coat. 
[24]I'm glad you came.  How long has it been? 
[25]It's amazing, you know?  Here you are. One day in America.  Now here. 
[26]But in Paris your old friend Eric has a job for you, so you came.  That's good. 
[27]You would have been stupid to. 
[28]After school I spent some time in Algeria studying African philosophy.  And then I bummed around.  You know.  For fun.  For a while I worked at Le Figaro.  The newspaper. 
[29]Yes.  With an assumed Masters degree. And lately we have just been bombing fascists here in Paris.  You know, like terrorists. 
[30]It's fun. 
[31]The people next door are on holiday.  We took their phone.  If you want to make a long distance call, go ahead. 
[32]I don't know.  I think it's asleep but it's been there for days. 
[33]I guess it is dead. 
[34]Hello. 
[35]Okay.  This is Francois, Ricardo, Jean, Oliver, and Claude.  Got it? 
[36]They all know who you are. Ne soyez pa salauds.  Offrez une biere au plus grand perceur de coffres. 
[37]Don't sit next to that junkie. 
[38]That little shit monkey of yours pissed on my Billy Holiday albums.  Next time he's out the door. Zed, come here. 
[39]Don't ask me where we got this. 
[40]On Bastille Day, all the banks are closed. 
[41]But this one.  BIP.  The Banque Internationale de Paris.  And for being greedy capitalists perhaps they will remain closed next Bastille day.  Yes? 
[42]We will go in and shut the bank down. Now, look at this. 
[43]As you can see, only one person can start the alarm. The concierge, at this desk. We will take care of him.  Then we can close the bank.  No one will know the difference since every other bank will be closed. 
[44]Ahhh!  He's right next to the door.  We'd have to be totally incompetent not to stop him.  Don't worry about that. 
[45]Here.  This is where they keep the days reserve cash.  Okay fuck that. 
[46]There are many vaults downstairs, but this is the vault we must get into.  This is where the real prize is. 
[47]Ah...Swiss made.  A Caliber. 
[48]No, that's too long. 
[49]Well shit.  It's too long.  We have to be in and out. Like that.  Or there will be suspicion. A little time is okay...but too long and... 
[50]Another vault. 
[51]I don't know...it connects the two vaults. 
[52]Also Swiss, but this one is a Poseidon. 
[53]I don't know. 
[54]But this entry way is too small to get the platen out.  We have a lot of merchandise in there. 
[55]You could open it in five minutes? 
[56]Hot damn.  That is our answer. 
[57]Tomorrow. 
[58]But of course. 
[59]It's not impossible.  Everyone knows what to do. 
[60]You don't need to know shit.  Just get into the vault and we'll do the rest. 
[61]Fuck the bank.  Before we do a job we live life.  It's better that way.  Okay? 
[62]Good.  Now we do heroin! 
[63][Cotton.] 
[64][Here, shut up and hold this.] 
[65][Don't want to get air bubbles in my veins.] 
[66][Hold my arm.] My vein is like a rock.

[134][Any others I should worry about?] 
[135][Well, just to be sure--] 
[136][Who the fuck are you?] 
[137][Making a deposit I hope.] [Bring him with us.] 
[138][Shut your fucking mouths!] 
[139][You think we're fucking amateurs?  You think we're stupid?  I've got news for you...we planned ahead my friend!] 
[140][Now save us a lot of time and just open the vault.] 
[141][Okay.] 
[142][Open the vault.] 
[143][Oh.] [Can you?] 
[144][Then open it.] 
[145][Do you understand that I'll kill her if you don't open this fucking vault?] 
[146][Open the vault door or I'll kill this man next.] 
[147][Come on.  It's only things in there. This man is flesh and blood.] 
[148]Shut the fuck up! [You're a customer in this bank and this is how they treat you.  Do you have a family?] 
[149][Would you like to see them again?] 
[150][This man has a family he would like to have Bastille day dinner with tonight. So save us some time and open the vault.] 
[151]Fucking idiot. [You seem like a nice man.  Tonight at dinner think about how lucky you are and how much you love your family.] 
[152][Take him upstairs.] 
[153]Don't you ever conflict with me during work again!  Do you hear!? 
[154]Oh, I'm sorry.  I didn't realize you were in charge now.  Nobody told me. If he had opened the vault it would have saved us a fucking hour.

I've got plenty hostages here to kill so don't even think of coming in.] [Just stay put.  We'll call you when we're ready.  In the mean time, have a nice day.]

And you're not going to follow us.] [Who do you fucking think is going to supply the plane?  Us?  No, you fucking imbecile, the French taxpayers would be a good second guess for you. [271]I give you little kiss.  Ciao.

[38]Oh.

[42]If these things you make are as true as you are...I'm sure they're as indescribable.  Perhaps, someday, you'll make one...about me. 
[43]I have no idea.  Night time. 
[44]Eric.  Come in. 
[45]Sorry, I asked the hotel to give me a wake up call. 
[46]What about the girl? 
[47]No.

[49]Eric. 
[50]Jesus Eric. 
[51]Eric, I liked that girl. 
[52]Because you were on a rampage.

[55]Okay, let me take a shower. 
[56]Oh. 
[57]Years.

[76]No, don't you see?  We get in through this secondary vault and take this passage to the other main vault.  From the inside I could open the Caliber vault in five minutes. 
[77]From the inside it's easy. 
[78]Okay.  When is Bastille day? 
[79]Tomorrow!?  We're doing this tomorrow? 
[80]It's impossible. 
[81]I don't know what to do. 
[82]I haven't even seen the bank. 
[83]Okay. 
[84]No, I want to be sharp for tomorrow. 
[85]I don't think so. 
[86]Yes. 
[87]Is tomorrow really Bastille day? 
[88]Really? 
[89]Well, Eric's mother is American. 
[90]They're divorced.  And she and his father had some kind of six month split plan set up.  So every six months he would come back to the states.  We were best friends.  Eventually he and his mother had a falling out and he stayed here. It's been...years. 
[91]Well...I suppose.  I used to be, when I was young. 
[92]Yeah...I guess. 
[93]Yeah.

[160]You asshole!  You could have killed us all. 
[161]Go around and wait at the main vault door.  When I tell you, open it up. 
[162]Right. 
[163]We're not out of here yet. 
[164]Are you still there? 
[165]Oliver, now!  Open the vault!

[167]Do you want to give me a hand?

[177]No I didn't know!  How many police?

[179]What kind of men are we? 
[180]What about our friendship? 
[181]Zoe... 
[182]Be serious Zoe...I can stick my tongue through my cheek. 
[183]What about the others? 
[184]Zoe. 
[185]Eric...there's no fucking way out of here! 
[186]Zoey, get out of here! 
[187]No. 
[188]I'm so tired. 
[189]No...it was mostly his blood. 
[190]Thank you Zoe.
dialogues.ZOEY:
[1]Bonjour.

[40]But someday there will be only my art. 
[41]I don't paint.  I make things.  Objects. Not like sculpture.  Like life...but with no narrative.  I want when someone looks at one of my objects for there to be no reference to the world.  Void of feeling, emotion...void of destiny.  Those are left for me.  They belong only to me.  If someone else can see into it...then it is no longer mine.  I have failed.  And I would destroy it.  I don't care how much cash they would offer me.  It would be shit.  I can't tell you how many objects of mine have been destroyed.  They told too much about me.  And if someone wants to know something about me...I'll tell them myself.  The way I'm telling you. 
[42]What I do I do only for the objects.

[45]If I do...you'll never know which one it is.  Because I'll be the only one who understands.  I'll be the only one who can look into it and see where in my life it came from.

[58][I work here.  This man is a customer...he needs medical help.] 
[59]The hospital? 
[60]Come on.  I have a car. 
[61]We'll go to my flat.  You can rest there. Do you feel pain? 
[62]I have a shower.  You can clean up there. 
[63]My name is not Zoe.  Not any more. 
[64]You'll get well.  Then I'll show you the real Paris.

dialogues.ON STAGE:
